content.description: <math alttext="The figure presents a 2 row table, with 8 columns of data. The heading for row 1 is “x,” and the heading for row 2 is “f of x.” The data in the table are as follows. Column 1. x is 3.9. f of x is 5.8. Column 2. x is 3.99. f of x is 5.85. Column 3. x is 3.999. f of x is 5.9. Column 4. x is 3.9999. f of x is 5.95. Column 5. x is 4.0001. f of x is 6.999. Column 6. x is 4.001. f of x is 6.99. Column 7. x is 4.01. f of x is 6.9. Column 8. x is 4.1. f of x is 6. " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mtable columnlines="solid" columnspacing="0.0em" columnwidth="3em 0.05em 3em 3em 4em 4em 4em 4em 3em 3em" equalrows="true" frame="solid" framespacing="0.0em 0.5ex" rowlines="solid" rowspacing="1ex" width="auto"><mtr><mtd><mi>x</mi></mtd><mtd><mspace depth="1.0ex" height="2.25ex" width="0.0em"></mspace></mtd><mtd><mn>3.9</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>3.99</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>3.999</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>3.9999</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>4.0001</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>4.001</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>4.01</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>4.1</mn></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mtd><mtd><mspace depth="1.0ex" height="2.25ex" width="0.0em"></mspace></mtd><mtd><mn>5.8</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>5.85</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>5.9</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>5.95</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>6.999</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>6.99</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>6.9</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>6</mn></mtd></mtr></mtable></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>
content.question: The table above gives values of the function <math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> at selected values of <math alttext="x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>. Which of the following conclusions is supported by the data in the table?

choices.label: <math alttext="the limit as x approaches 4, of, f of x, equals 6" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><munder><mrow><mi>lim</mi><mo>⁡</mo></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>→</mo><mn>4</mn></mrow></munder><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>=</mo><mn>6</mn></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the limit as x approaches 4, of, f of x, equals 7" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><munder><mrow><mi>lim</mi><mo>⁡</mo></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>→</mo><mn>4</mn></mrow></munder><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>=</mo><mn>7</mn></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the limit as x approaches 4 from the left, of, f of x, equals 6" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><munder><mrow><mi>lim</mi><mo>⁡</mo></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>→</mo><msup><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></munder><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>=</mo><mn>6</mn></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="the limit as x approaches 4 from the right, of, f of x, equals 7" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><munder><mrow><mi>lim</mi><mo>⁡</mo></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>→</mo><msup><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow><mrow><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></munder><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>=</mo><mn>7</mn></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the limit as x approaches 4 from the left, of, f of x, equals 7" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><munder><mrow><mi>lim</mi><mo>⁡</mo></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>→</mo><msup><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></munder><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>=</mo><mn>7</mn></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="the limit as x approaches 4 from the right, of, f of x, equals 6" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><munder><mrow><mi>lim</mi><mo>⁡</mo></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>→</mo><msup><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow><mrow><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></munder><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>=</mo><mn>6</mn></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="the limit as x approaches 4 from the left, of, f of x, equals 6" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><munder><mrow><mi>lim</mi><mo>⁡</mo></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>→</mo><msup><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></munder><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>=</mo><mn>6</mn></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="the limit as x approaches 4 from the right, of, f of x, equals 7" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><munder><mrow><mi>lim</mi><mo>⁡</mo></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>→</mo><msup><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow><mrow><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></munder><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>=</mo><mn>7</mn></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

skill.text: Skill 2.B: Identify mathematical information from graphical, numerical, analytical, and/or verbal representations.
